fields.description:
We need to calculate the average resolution time for an issue within a Tracker project.  Currently i have been using the difference between the created and updated date for all issues which are resolved or closed.  However as we use a two stage resolution process, there can be any amount of time between an issue being closed once resolved.

So i need to know how to calculate the length of time an issue takes to becoming resolved OR closed (the first time).  Can you help me figure out how i can query the db to extract this data - initial thoughts are to look at the change hisrtory however i am not sure how to do this

Thanks
fields.summary: How to calculate time taken for issue to be resolved

fields.description:
Make the "Change by" human-readable. The generic Field - Original Value - New Value is really hard to read. For example on this bug, there was a change by Anton today with three fields updated. Takes me a while to read all that with the table format. It would be so much more readable if it looked like this:

Edited by Anton Mazkovoi [14/Jul/05 05:35 AM]
  ...Fix Version/s set to 3.3 [11121]
  ...Assigned to Dylan Etkin [dylan@atlassian.com]
  ...and Priority changed from Major [3] to Critical [2]

For a resolved bug, something like:

Resolved as By Design by Anton Mazkovoi [14/Jul/05 05:35 AM]
  ...and Assigned to Dylan Etkin [dylan@atlassian.com]

Something like that. So the first line would be what happened, and lines after that would simply say in English what changed (similar to how the workflow editor prints field change tasks in English). It would be so much easier to read, and then I'd just leave my browser in "All" mode all the time.

This is what MS's Product Studio does, and it's really nice and compact.
fields.summary: Word change items better

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to remove permissions based on group membership, rather than having permissions be a simple union of all the groups a user is in.

This came up in our use of JIRA because we want to have a standard configuration for the majority of users, and want to restrict access of certain users slightly.  One convenient way to do this would be to create a group for the users in question, and mark the permission of, say, "View Voters and Watchers" such that the permission is *removed* for members of that group.
fields.summary: Add capability to remove permissions based on group.

fields.description: It would be useful to allow users other than the administrator to send email.  For example, we want to be able to put all of the contractors on our project into a group and then email that group without having to be administrator.   If this were one of the permissions that could be added to a group, the "can send email" permission, that would be great.
fields.summary: Add ability to send email as a permission.

fields.description:
In its current state, JIRA cannot be clustered. This is very bad for high availability environments where we heavily depend on JIRA.  Our experience with JIRA over the last year is that it is not a 100% robust application and is prone to falling down.  Further, a single instance application does not scale very well. Clustering would help with server stability, allow for scaling to meet high demands, and allow for scheduled server maintenance to not interrupt the service.  It is ignorant to believe that one instance is all an enterprise environment will ever need.

The main bottlenecks appear to be:
1) sessions
2) attachments
3) indexes

I would suggest that following strategies to solve these problems
1) remove all session dependencies - make the application stateless by using a combination of cookies, and referrer links. We have undergone the same endeavors with our applications (Java & .NET) and with a little ingenuity, has created a very fast application that is much more resilient to application restarts.

2) Move attachments to the database.  Any serious use of this application should be using MSSQL, Oracle or other commercial servers which have very efficient handling of attachments and large binary arrays.

3) A realization that has helped us immensely is that real-time data, does not mean instantaneous synchronization in a web environment.  TTL based caching is for most cases, more than good enough. Generally speaking, as long as the current user sees his changes as being applied (searches return with his changes), other users on other cluster nodes can see stale data for a short period of time.
fields.summary: Implement cluster support

fields.description:
We are in the process of deploying JIRA for support (support.rivermine.com). Our customers have a request for us, that we cannot accomodate with the current system. They would like to be able to add others at their organization to watch an issue once they open it. This can be accomodated by going into "Watching" but there are two major problems.

1. Since multiple customers are on the system, we have to restrict permissions to the user browser so that customers cannot see other customers names, email addresses, etc. This means that to add users to watch an issue, a customer has to know the user's ID on the JIRA instance. This could be resolved perhaps by a rule that we could configure such that users can use the user browser, but will only see users at their organization. Note that we currently have a workaround that classifies users at an organization based on the email domain. 

2. Related to #1, this workaround requires that customers have a JiRA login. This is not the case for all users. Most often, our users serve as a central contact point for our customer's organization, and other users report issues to those central contact points, who then open tickets with us. Ideal would be to allow either JiRA users or just any email address to be added to the watchers list.
fields.summary: Watching an issue as a non-user

fields.description:
Chaps & Chappettes,
                                                                                                                                                             
We have done some work on Jira's database performance, and have come up
with some performance enhancements. (Very significant if you are using SQL
Server 2000+)
                                                                                                                                                             
First of all, if you are using SQL Server 2000, there is a huge perf gain
to be had by setting up string database columns as unicode (varchar is
ascii).
If your jdbc driver is sending strings as unicode (you can force some to
send ascii), and the columns are ascii, then SQL server wont use any
indexes that exist for those ascii columns.
This means most of the indexing wont be used.
                                                                                                                                                             
We have added a new database "dialect" mssql2000 that sets up string
columns as nvarchar (ie unicode) for all strings. The existing mssql one
uses varchar (ascii)
NB (text stays as text, rather than ntext - as we dont index those fields,
so we dont care).
Here is the mssql2000 dialect:
(See attached file: fieldtype-mssql2000.xml)
                                                                                                                                                             
We have also added some indexes and modified one existing one.
Here is the modified entitymodel.xml with the new/modified indexes (if you
are installing a new Jira instance)
Here is also a "delta" script that you can execute on your existing Jira
3.2 database:
(See attached file: optimised-jira-3.2-entitymodel.xml)
(See attached file: optimised-jira-3.2-index-delta.sql)
                                                                                                                                                             
Many thanks to Michael Thorpe, who did much of the work.
fields.summary: Update JIRA's mssql mappings to improve performance

fields.description:
Consider this scenario:

  1. Query 200 bugs

  2. Bulk edit them all

  3. Painstakingly go through them and check the ones that need bulk modifying

  4. Hit the Next button

  5. Select Edit and hit Next

  6. Realize that some of the issues you checked in #3 do not have the field that you want modified in them (we have an issue type "Deliverable" that has "Priority" disabled).

  7. Go back, and see that all the checks are lost. All work done in #3 down the drain...

Feature request: either (a) support the browser's 'back' so that I can go back to the bulk edit page and un-check the ones that are messing up the bulk edit, or (b) add a 'back' button to step 2 of bulk edit. Right now all I can do is go forward or cancel.
fields.summary: Support 'back' when bulk editing

fields.description:
The attached Python SOAP client essentially does:

token = soap.login(jirauser, passwd)
soap.getAllPermissions(token)

This breaks with a cryptic XML parse error:

unknown>:1:497: duplicate attribute

Further investigation reveals that JIRA is generating invalid XML in response to the SOAP query (see attached response.xml).  The problem is the duplicated xsi:type attribute, which is duplicated (not allowed in XML):

<getAllPermissionsReturn  soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemotePermission[20]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array" xsi:type="soapenc:Array" ...
fields.summary: SOAP servlet generating invalid XML, breaks Python clients

fields.description:
The Create Issue Handler looks for an X-Priority header in the email to use when setting the priority on the issue being created, but there is a problem with the way it calculates which priority to use.  The first thing to note is that the priority number it calculates is used according to the order of the priorities in JIRA, not the actual priority numbers/codes.  So a value of 1 means it would select the first priority as listed/organized in JIRA, a value of 2 means it would select the second priority, etc. (regardless of what their actual number/code is).

The calculation it performs is:
  int priorityNumber = (int) Math.ceil(((double) priorities.size() / 5d) * priorityValue);

In the code above priorities.size() gets the number of priorities in JIRA and priorityValue is the value from the X-Priority email header.  The problem is multiplying the value from the X-Priority header by (priorities.size() / 5); I don't understand the reasoning behind it and I think it's the wrong thing to do.

The default JIRA installation has five priorities, so in that case (priorities.size() / 5) = 1 and the calculation essentially becomes priorityNumber = priorityValue.  However we only have three priorities (low, medium, and high) so for us (priorities.size() / 5) = 0.6 and the calculation becomes priorityNumber = ceil(0.6 * priorityValue).  This means that in order to have the first priority selected we'd set the X-Priority header to 1.  So far so good.  But in order to select the second priority we'd set the X-Priority header to either 2 or 3 since both ceil(1.2) and ceil(1.8) = 2, and in order to select the third priority we'd have to set the X-Priority header to either 4 or 5 since ceil(2.4) and ceil(3.0) = 3.  This is extremely non-intuitive, confusing behavior and I probably wouldn't have figured this out if I wasn't able to look at the source code.

I'd recommend either of two ways to fix this:
  1.  Take the value from the X-Priority header to be the priority number (according to the order of priorities in JIRA) without multiplying it by (priorities.size() / 5).  I.e. have "int priorityNumber = priorityValue;".  If the X-Priority header is set to 3 the third priority should be selected.
      This has the benefit of being more backwards compatible with how things are done now, but it still relies on the order/organization of the priorities in JIRA.

  2.  Take the value from the X-Priority header to be the actual priority number/code used behind the scenes by JIRA and if there is a priority with that number/code use it, otherwise use the default middle/medium priority.
      This is less backwards compatible (though it would still work fine for the priorities in the default JIRA installation) but it has the benefit of not being tied to the order/organization of the priorities, so they could be rearranged and this would still work correctly.

We're running version 2.6.1 but the way the Create Issue Handler calculates the priority is still the same in the latest version of JIRA which is why I marked all versions from 2.6.1 to 3.2.2 as being affected.  I used the following source files for reference:
  http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.6.1/examples/CreateIssueHandler.java
  http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/examples/CreateIssueHandler.java
fields.summary: Create Issue Handler calculates priority incorrectly when number of priorities is not five

fields.description:
Currently the Document version of an issue (JRA-6874) is limited to system fields, and is badly hard-coded.  We need to introduce a new interface for fields that can load their values from the document, and use that instead.

We can then allow custom fields to load their own values from the document.  This would improve performance in the issue navigator significantly when large numbers of custom fields are displayed (from my calculations - it would roughly halve the time to display the table).
fields.summary: Allow custom fields to show values in Issue Navigator based on the Lucene document

fields.description:
Having only jira administrators allowed to create projects is limiting. Each department usually has a person that you would like to appoint to manage their group's set of projects and create new ones. If you could setup a new configurable permission set whereby the jira administrators set the following for the user they plan to allow project creator rights:

Administrators will preset the following for each "special" user:

1) Permission scheme - all projects created by the special user will use the assigned permission scheme set by the admin(s).
2) Notification scheme - all projects created by the special user will use the assigned notification scheme set by the admin(s).
fields.summary: Add a Project creator permission for individually selected users

fields.summary: Anonymous comments cause errors when generating an XML (RSS) view of an issue or a filter

fields.description:
Reproduction:
1) Create a new issue
2) Get a bitmap file (.bmp), and rename it test.jpg (yes, I know this qualifies as silly)
3) Attach the now silly image to your new issue from #1
4) witness the log file explode with stack traces, and see the broken thumbnails on the issue

I'm not asking you guys to invent smarter users, we're working on them over here, but the thumbnailing code should handle this error more gracefully as it is user input and the principle of the internet is to "be liberal in what accept".

You should expect users to upload all manner of mislabeled or non-conforming junk, and not error out because of it. It might be a valid attachment, and you're just inferring too much from the name
fields.summary: Jira thumbnailing code mishandles attachments with errors

fields.description:
I think it would be useful to know the parent of issues remotely.  Right now the only difference (as I can see) is that the sub tasks have a sub task issue type.  A method which returned the parent of an issue would be useful, or alternatively RemoteIssue could have a parameter parentKey where the the parent of the subtask is identified (or null if it is not a sub task).

I would appreciate this feature.
fields.summary: Soap: GetSubTaskParent(IssueKey)

fields.description: The UI does not enforce the < 255 characters for a custom field of that type and if you are running against a db that also does not care, like hsql, then you can get data that will not happily import into another type of db.
fields.summary: If you are creating a custom field of Type Text Field (< 255 characters) UI does not enforce field length

fields.description:
All current notifications are related to operations on issue.

Some project related events might be interesting to be notified of. The most obvious I see is 'Version Released' but other could be interesting such as version archived, component added, component removed, ...
fields.summary: CLONE -Notification of project events

fields.description: When the original estimate column is added in the Navigator View, some of the issues show "0 minutes", but when you  open the issue, it shows the correct "original estimate" value. (See attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Discrepancy on the Original Estimate in the Navigator View.

fields.description: Please see JRA-7160. Please follow up on this - at least with a comment.
fields.summary: Missing reply from you

fields.description: Right now, when you choose release notes from the browse project tab you can output to html or text. Please add wiki as well and output to wiki notation for easier integration to Confluence.
fields.summary: Release notes should output to Confluence Wiki notation as well as html and text

fields.description: Editing the values of fields and custom fields would be greatly enhanced by adding the ability to move inidividual values in the list to the top or bottom of the available options. Being able to specify the order each field should be in would also be another way to to go here and may be even more practical.
fields.summary: Add 'Move to Top' & 'Move to Bottom' options to field value edit screens
Hide individual field values

fields.summary: Error in Jira when trying to connect to page

fields.description:
"One additonal improvement to conditions, permissions and customisations to workflows would be to allow combinations of transition conditions to use AND, OR and NOT logic.

Presently, each time a condition is added to a transition, Jira uses the AND logic.

----

Two additional handy conditions would be:

"progressor belongs to same group(s) as:

* reporter
* assignee
* resolver"

and

"User is NOT in Group"

These permission/conditions would of course have to be applied with care (for a reporter, assignee and resolver can and often do belong to multiple groups).

The permission and conditions could be implemented as customisations, but it would be much nicer if they came standard."
fields.summary: Workflow editor should allow AND/OR/NOT logic when specifying conditions
Automatically add existing open issues to newly defined versions

issuetype doesn't exist") instead of getting an Invalid IssueType error
message, I get an NPE."
fields.summary: NullPointerException in SOAP API when passing invalid issuetype

fields.description: We implemented a Select type Custom Field with 5 values. Each of these 5 values incorporates HTML text to include an image. This Custom Field - Severity has the following options: Blocker (default) Critical Major Minor Trivial Many issues use these options. When a change is made to one of these options an email notification is sent highlighting the change. The email contains a reference to the HTML like: Severity: Trivial (was: Trival) The HTML in this context should be removed. NOTE: If we had defined the alt text in the HTML, this might have read correctly in the email, but due to JRA-2983 I won't want to be 'updating' the custom field any time soon.
fields.summary: Remove HTML in Email notification for change to Custom Field with HTML in option value

fields.description: We implemented a Select type Custom Field with 5 values. Each of these 5 values incorporates HTML text to include an image. This Custom Field - Severity has the following options: Blocker (default) Critical Major Minor Trivial Many issues use these options. When a user performs a search, they can filter on Severity. However the values that appear in the drop down box show some mangled HTML. The options in the drop down are poorly displayed (see attached) as: Any Blocker" > Blocker Critical" > Critical Major" > Major Minor" > Minor Trivial" > Trival Please ensure that the options are displayed as: Any Blocker Critical Major Minor Trival
fields.summary: Custom Field Select option values with HTML text are strange in Filter Search

fields.description: We need a web-based custom report building tool that allow users to create basically any kind of report that they want using any JIRA fields.
fields.summary: Create a web-based custom report building tool

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7266].
  {panel}

*Original request description:*
 
As a JIRA administrator I want to make sure that the notifications sent from JIRA are actionable and reflect the recipients' expectation related to the content and format. I can change current JIRA email format by manual editing of velocity files, but that is not an efficient way of doing so, and it is not supported for Cloud instances of JIRA.
 
What I need is an email template editor in JIRA's web-interface so that users can create customised email templates that are used for notifications and subscriptions.
It would also be ideal to have the ability to create and manage multiple email templates which could be then assigned to the relevant filter subscription or notification.

*Problem mitigation*

When deciding to address problems related to email template editing, we went carefully through comments to understand all the pains that were pointed out. As an outcome, we have made a decision to implement a multi-step approach to the suggested problem.

The problems that we have heard repeatedly and decided to address them:

* JRASERVER-71858 - Lack of comprehensive documentation to support syntax understanding and templates editing
* JRASERVER-71859 - The necessity to restart the Jira instance after email templates editing
* JRASERVER-71860 - Performance spikes causing Jira outages when editing email templates
* JRASERVER-71861 - Necessity to access Velocity (.vm) files from the Jira directory causing the process longer
* JRASERVER-71862 - The risk of breaking templates during an upload due to missing files
* JRASERVER-71863 - Extra work required after each Jira upgrade to keep email templates up-to-date

As many of our customers appreciate the flexibility of having the ability to edit email template files itself, we have decided to:

* move the Velocity (.vm) files from the Jira directory to Jira home so that any upgrade of Jira will be smooth without an additional, manual effort;
* support the process of email editing by performing the majority of actions through Jira UI - downloading, uploading the templates package;
* mitigate the risk of breaking emails - the system will verify if all required files are included to make sure that the risk of breaking emails is reduced;
* provide documentation that should guide through the process of editing.

We are open to hearing additional feedback and we would love to hear customer’s voices. With that, we have decided to open a JAC ticket as the outcome of the feedback we have received from you:

* JRASERVER-71864 - As a Jira administrator, I want to test email template changes before deploying them to production

We encourage you to review the release notes, test the newest enhancements, and let us know here on in the ticket above (or any other related ticket) about any additional problems you are still experiencing. 

Related articles:

* [Jira Software 8.14.x release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-14-x-release-notes-1027133861.html]
* [Email templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/email-templates-1027125900.html]
* [Customizing email content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/customizing-email-content-938847640.html]
* [Syntax documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/templates-batched-issue-notifications-and-other-events-976770772.html]
fields.summary: Create an Email Template Editor in the UI to Replace Editing Velocity Templates

fields.description:
Xml view seems broken for issues with custom fields

The @issue object in the RSS view sems to now be a GenericValue and not an Issue object. Fixing this also reveals a problem with an "escape" method somewhere. 

We need to fix both of these problems.
fields.summary: Xml view seems broken for issues with custom fields

fields.description: The "Version Picker" custom field had a very different look from the built in "Effect Version" and "Fix Version" fields.  The interface would be much more friendly and consistent if the "Version Picker" custom field had the same look as the other version fields.
fields.summary: Version Picker Custom Field  Needs Improvement

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7261]. {panel} It's been reported that when that mis-configured Svn plugin properties file (or removal of the specified user account) can stop Jira from starting. We should invesigate this and perhaps try to contain the error (to not be so catastrophic) From e-mail: Problem Description: I have a properly configured and running Jira server, with the Subversion plugin indexing and working against a Subversion repository. I was using a local .htaccess file to authenticate users, with usernames and passwords added in manually, for the Subversion repository. In the .htaccess file I had a 'jira' user, which was configured in the subversion plugin properties file to connect to the subversion server. This morning I switched authentication for our Subversion repo to an enterprise LDAP server. It works fine for all users - but the 'jira' user that the svn plugin in Jira was configured to use did not exist in the LDAP directory. I restarted Jira (for other reasons) and it failed to come back up. The relevant parts of catalina.out (I believe) are copied below. I have resolved the issue by removing the svn plugin from my running Jira installation, and will either add a jira account to my LDAP directory, or connect via a different method to the Svn repository. However, I thought you guys would like to know that a mis-configured Svn plugin properties file (or removal of the specified user account) can stop Jira from starting... fields.description: All edit functions for our field values and custom field values need to include the 'Move to top' and 'Move to bottom' capability so that you can easily move values to the top and bottom of a list of values.
fields.summary: Edit function on field values and custom field values need move to top and move to bottom options

fields.description:
All of our edit functions need to be standardised. We need to set a best practice so that when creating edit screens you can move options up and down as well as to the top and to the bottom in a single click. We need to agree on what a best practice is and then ensure this functionality is consistent across the application.

This should extend further into editability of a function - e.g. if you can edit a screen, you can edit an email template, you can edit a report etc.
fields.summary: Edit Functions Need To Be Standardised

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7257].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

We need the ability to select multiple values in a cascading list. 

It would be good to also have an ALL option under each section for quickly selecting all options in a branch.
fields.summary: Allow multiple values to be selected in a cascading list

fields.description: The administration viewprojects page won't display on a MAC running I.E. Is JIRA supported for this browser?
fields.summary: Do you support I.E. on a MAC

fields.description:
Filters

Go to the Manage Filters page.  There are options to Edit, Delete, Subscribe, etc.  There is no option to rename.

Rename is found in the left column, on the page when the filter is executed. 

This is not a good user experience.  Each time I want to rename a filter I have to search for the rename option.  Please, at least, duplicate the "rename" function on the Manage Filters page.  It is a very similar operation to the other operations listed on that page.

Thank you!
fields.summary: "Rename" option should be available on "Manage Filters" page

fields.description:
We have a lot of users on our Jira site, lots of projects, and a complicated permissions model to make sure the right groups are permitted to see the right projects, and have the correct accesses inside.

Adding a new user is pretty error-prone. Some of it is automatable, but not much. Every time we add a new project or user, we have to go log in as that user to make sure they can only see the projects we want them to see. This is to protect IP rights of the various companies involved.

What would make this vastly quicker is to have a simple report we could generate of what users have permission to access what. Sort of an inside-out view of the current Jira permissions model, which is group and project focused, with users at the leaves of the tree. I'd like to be able to generate a report with the user at the root.

At minimum a really simple view when the admin goes to the user's page that just shows what projects they have access to would be perfect.
fields.summary: Implement reporting feature for permissions on a user

fields.description:
I was just writing up a separate bug and this happened. I accidentally hit alt+c instead of space. Jira loaded a new page, losing everything I had typed in.

Confluence has a feature to warn you if you're about to navigate away from a page that you've edited. Can we have something like this for Jira? If any fields have been modified, and the user clicks a link or uses a hotkey to navigate away, Jira should warn about it before letting the user continue.
fields.summary: Detect navigation away from bug editing page

fields.description: Adding ~15k text to the (this) description field causes Null Pointer Exception.  An error message would be nice.
fields.summary: Get NPE when adding too much text to issue description field.

fields.description:
I want to export a list of issues to Excel with the description included.

So in the find issues, I modify the Issue navigation configuration to add the description and it works.

But when I export to Excel by clicking on the Excel hyperlink, the outcome in Excel is the correct list of issues but without the description.

==> How can I add automatically the description in Excel then ?
fields.summary: Export to Excel: Not able to export the description

fields.description:
Often one wants some pages (eg. login page) to be protected via HTTPS, but then revert to plain HTTP for most pages, to avoid killing the server. The process of requiring HTTPS for some pages is described at:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS

however there doesn't seem to be a clean declarative way to force access of non-protected pages to revert to HTTP.
fields.summary: Support for redirecting from HTTPS to HTTP

fields.description: JIRA has a new general configuration option, whereby user email addresses can be public, hidden, masked, or shown only to logged-in users. The 'masked' option is currently fairly useless as a spam prevention measure, since only the human-visible part is masked. So one might have joe at example dot com.
fields.summary: Email masking option doesn't mask emails

fields.description:
The Mantis importer fails to import attachments from disk, reporting errors like:

2005-07-07 10:51:24,668 INFO [atlassian.jira.util.MantisImportBean] Error on importing attachments for bug 214. Error:Column 'mimetype' not found.
fields.summary: Mantis importer fails to import attachments: Column 'mimetype' not found
SOAP addAttachmentToIssue() method doesn't work

fields.description:
Signing up does not work when the default locale is French.

This occurs due to the following bug:
http://jira.opensymphony.com/browse/WW-801

as the submit button is named "S'enregistrer" (and has a ' character in it".

As a workaround please replace views/signup.jsp under the JIRA web application with the attached file. The ttached file hardcodes the submit value to 'Signup'.
fields.summary: Signup page fails with French locale

fields.description:
addVersion method does not allow the sequenceId to be set. 

This results in an error like:

com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException: Error creating versionCaused by java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.moveVersionSequences(DefaultVersionManager.java:137) at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.createVersion(DefaultVersionManager.java:81) at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.CreateVersionBean.createVersion(CreateVersionBean.java:68) at com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.service.ProjectServiceImpl.createVersion(ProjectServiceImpl.java:719) at com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.JiraSoapServiceImpl.addVersion(JiraSoapServiceImpl.java:83) at 

This is because the code mistakes the sequenceId for the id of the versin the new version will be created after
fields.summary: addVersion method does not allow the sequenceId to be set

fields.description: I wanted to share a filter with multiple groups, but it looks like I can only pick one. Is there an existing improvement request to change this? The documentation leads me to believe it is possible. But when I try, it replaces the previous group with the current one. If you visit the "Global Permissions" page, the description under "Create Shared Filter" says "Ability to share a filter globally or with groups of users. " In fact, it should probably read "Ability to share a filter globally or with a group of users. " if that is indeed the restriction.
fields.summary: cannot share filter with multiple groups

fields.description:
1) perform a clean jira instalation on an external db (oracle 9.2)
2) log in with admin user to the clean jira
3) create a new user with a diferent email adress that the admin user
4) perform a userSearch with any character of the new user email with "Any" filter

Result: jira returns the right user

5) import attached xipped .xml file
6) perform a user search with any filter

Result: Jira does not return any results, why?

It could be posible the the zipped xml file has any invalid character? how can i fix it? Is this a bug? is there any workaround?
fields.summary: UserSearch does not work  with "Any" after importing a backup

When trying to backup to XML, I get the following error: "An exception occurred backing up: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@1b229b0, result: error

fields.description: In JIRA 3.x one can create new workflow steps (eg. 'Validated'), but not new notification events for the new steps (eg. to notify QA people of Validated issues).  There is a 'generic' event which is triggered on transitions to user-defined steps, but this is often not sufficient.
fields.summary: Need new notification event types for new workflow steps

fields.description:
When an email fails to processed by Jira we try to forward the mail on to a specified address. This fails when reading from an IMAP box. The problem is with attachments and the fact that the session has been closed by the time we get to sending the mail through the mail queue.

The problem is:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.SendFailedException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is: 
	javax.mail.MessagingException: IOException while sending message;
  nested exception is: 
	java.io.IOException: javax.mail.FolderClosedException
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.mail.queue.SingleMailQueueItem.send(SingleMailQueueItem.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
Caused by: javax.mail.SendFailedException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is: 
	javax.mail.MessagingException: IOException while sending message;
  nested exception is: 
	java.io.IOException: javax.mail.FolderClosedException
	at javax.mail.Transport.send0(Transport.java:219)
	at javax.mail.Transport.send(Transport.java:81)
	at alt.javax.mail.TransportImpl.send(TransportImpl.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:146)
	... 7 more
fields.summary: Problem forwarding mails that have failed to be processed when reading against an imap mailbox

fields.description:
If your JIRA instance has a 'context path' part in the URL (something after the port), eg '/jira' in http://localhost:8090/jira, then clicking 'Unwatch' in the 'Watched issues' portlet redirects you to the wrong URL.  The link to click on is something like:

http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/UserWatches.jspa?delWatch=10000&returnUrl=/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa

and this redirects to:

http://localhost:8090/jira/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa

(notice the duplicate '/jira').
fields.summary: Unwatch link on 'Watched issues' portlet redirects to wrong URL

fields.description: When adding the watched issue portlet "My Watches" to the dashboard, I cannot see any pattern as to how the issues are sorted. I suspect there is no sort on there, and there should be something - issue key maybe?
fields.summary: Watched issue portlet doesn't appear to be ordered in any way

fields.description: For an bug with a long issue estimate (like 1w 1d), the original estimate is corrupted in issue navigator.  In the case of 1w 1d, it's displayed as 1d 12h.
fields.summary: Orginal Estimate inaccurate in Issue Navigator
